content: The "Senior Citizens' Financial Freedom Act" repeals the increase in tax on Social Security benefits and eliminates the earnings test for individuals who have attained retirement age. SEC. 4 amends the Internal Revenue Code to change the age for required minimum distributions from pension plans to the applicable age determined by a table.
